Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with access to water and light, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing it as unhealthy or wilting.
The student can draw a plant without light, showing it as unhealthy or not growing properly.
The student can illustrate the idea that plants need water to survive, using symbols or notes.
The student can illustrate the idea that plants need light to survive, using symbols or notes.
The student can observe and depict patterns of plant health based on access to water and light.
